Description: Flaring ring foot of Laconian black-glazed pottery krater; interior: glazed matt black; wall and outside of foot glazed; reserved underneath; hole drilled through bottom of base; inscription on underside.
Curator's comments: The base possibly belongs to an all-black stirrup-krater. Unlike other Laconian kraters with white-slipped and decorated rims, all-black kraters were glazed black throughout except, most notably, on the underside of the foot. Stibbe, (1989), 14. The drill hole in the base was probably made to render the krater unusable.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (pl. XXXIV, no. 559)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 673, no. 317)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GC.53) (phase 3)
